sub_title: Lead Engineer Rockworks at Royal HaskoningDHV
summary:
Emiel is a qualified Construction Engineer with a broad national and international experience in the maritime sector, water edge and urban development.  Emiel has been given input in various stages of projects from studies, design to supervision, with significant experience in construction supervision. He worked on major land reclamation projects, port developments, flood defences and urban developments. 

Under various roles he has been responsible for but not limited to; project management, contract management, construction management, project engineering, quality control, coordination and design review.  

Through the majority over the last 8 years whereby Emiel has worked overseas he gained valuable experience in dealing with cultural differences and finding a collaborative way to work with all parties involved in the project. He enjoys to be involved in the realisation of projects whereby he is able to guide the translation of design into reality including solving technical issues that arise during construction. With strong client focus he is striving for the successful completion of projects complying with international quality and safety standards.

profile_positions.description: I am working as Lead Engineer Rockworks on the Femern Baelt tunnel project in Denmark for the quality supervision during construction of the works.
profile_positions.title: Lead Engineer Coastal Protection

profile_positions.description:
Dynamic Mining Bauxite Barging Logistics Chain

Dynamic Mining (DM) has acquired a mining licence in Guinea and is in the process of developing the logistic chain
from the mine area to the barge loading station (via trucks) and on to the transhipment station offshore. Emiel has been supervising the geotechnical survey for this project. The SoW consisted of 16 onshore and 4 offshore boreholes to be executed.
profile_positions.title: Geotechnical supervision

profile_positions.description:
Renovation Dutch Embassy Jakarta  

The renovation works consisted of creating an “Activity Based Office Concept” (open & flexible work environment), and replacing the current Mechanical and Electrical system.
The PM role from Emiel was to be responsible for the quality, progress and coordination of the construction works, and provide support to the supervision team on Site.
profile_positions.title: Project Manager

profile_positions.description:
Pluit City Land development project  

Pluit City is being developed in the bay of Jakarta by one of the biggest property developers in Indonesia. On this project he is assigned as Design and Contract Manager following the FIDIC guidelines (yellow book). This reclamation and coastal protection project of 160ha is mostly being reclaimed on top of soft soil along a live gas pipeline of a nearby power plant. This is asking for innovative design solutions and extensive monitoring systems during the execution of the project. Since the Contractor is responsible for the final design. Emiel did coordinate the review of the design documents of the Contractor and assisted the Resident Engineer in Contractual matters. He is Acting Resident Engineer leading the team and first point of contact for the Client during the leave periods of the Resident Engineer. The total costs of the project are approx. 380M US Dollars.
profile_positions.title: Design and Contract Manager

profile_positions.description:
KITe Flood Study

The consortium comprising Pertamina, PGN LNG and Engie (the “Client”), has asked Royal HaskoningDHV to do a flood study to determine the flood risk and advise on a flood save land level for 9 greenfield LNG Gas Power Plant locations in Indonesia. This study needed to be done in a short time and Emiel ensured that the quality standard didn’t suffer under the time pressure.
profile_positions.title: Quality Control Engineer

profile_positions.description:
CFLD Tangerang Urban development project  

This Urban development project covers an area of 2850ha. As the project manager Emiel is responsible to manage the multidisciplinary team (international and local) of engineers and experts. The scope includes the Engineering Master Plan including; water supply, wastewater, storm water drainage, grading plan, transport system road design, flood control and protection of the river embankments.
profile_positions.title: Project Manager

profile_positions.description:
Kapuk Naga Indah Land development project  

On this technical challenging mega project he is responsible for design review and construction management. This polder island has been reclaimed on top of soft soil and protected by dikes with a rock revetment, with rock up to 3000kg to withstand the worst storm conditions in 10,000 years. He is reporting to the Resident Engineer (RE), but is acting Resident Engineer himself during the leave periods of the RE. He is actively involved in the design review process, design meetings and supervision. For contractual matters the FIDIC guidelines (red book) are being followed. Further on this project Emiel had the opportunity to improve the Health, Safety and Environment (HSE) standards on Site by implementing joint inspections whereby the lesser experienced contractors could see and learn from the experienced international contractors how to improve. The total costs of the project are approx. 400M US Dollars.
profile_positions.title: Assistant Resident Engineer

profile_positions.description:
Eko Atlantic Project Lagos 

As a Project Engineer for this project, he is the key person for the dredging & reclamation works. One of his main responsibilities is to undertake the Contractor’s progress survey volume computations prior to approval for payment and dealing with contractual matters. He is also responsible for the coordination and supervision of the survey works (topographic and hydrographic) managing a team of 7 local staff. The project consists of the construction of an 8.4 km long rock revetment sea defence and 10 km2 of land to be reclaimed and requiring approx. 90 Mil. m³ of sand. The total costs of the project are approx. 1.0 Billion US Dollars.
profile_positions.title: Project Engineer / Assistant Resident Engineer

profile_positions.description:
Fly ash Terminal Moerdijk 

For the construction of 3 concrete storage silo’s up to 58m of height. He operated on his own at the construction site and reported to project director at the office. The 3 silos consisted of 11,000 m3 concrete heavily reinforced with 1200t reinforcement. The storage capacity in total is about 30,000t and the total costs of the project around € 15.0 M EURO.
profile_positions.title: Supervisor

profile_positions.description:
Port of Cotonou development project

Emiel was part of the PMC project management consultant team. He gained valuable dredging experience as he was supervising the dredging works and the in/out bathymetrical surveys. He spent about 500 hours on board of the dredging vessel. He also worked on the construction site supervising the works on quality and HSE. The onshore work consisted of the construction of a new quay, road works including shore protection (small armoured revetment with crown wall), and the extension of an Accropode armoured breakwater. In between the supervision work he supported the site office with reviewing design work and writing reports.
profile_positions.title: Deputy Assistant Resident Engineer
